meanings.definition: To cause someone to feel isolated or estranged.
meanings.sent1: Her constant criticism was alienating her friends.
meanings.sent2: The new student's rude behavior was alienating others in the class.
meanings.sent3: The grumpy cat's aloof attitude was alienating the other pets.
meanings.sent4: The high walls of the castle seemed to be alienating the town from the outside world.
meanings.sent5: The eerie silence in the haunted house was alienating to anyone who dared to enter.

meanings.definition: To make someone feel unwelcome or excluded.
meanings.sent1: His rude remarks were alienating potential customers.
meanings.sent2: The exclusive club's strict rules were alienating many interested individuals.
meanings.sent3: The grumpy old man's constant complaints were alienating his neighbors.
meanings.sent4: The thick fog was alienating the travelers from the familiar path.
meanings.sent5: The dark clouds looming overhead were alienating the warmth of the sun.
